thread.title: Miles not commenting on SEC response to Fournette hits
thread.title_full: Miles not commenting on SEC response to Fournette hits

title: Miles not commenting on SEC response to Fournette hits
text:
Miles not commenting on SEC response to Fournette hits GLENN GUILBEAU, Gannett Louisiana 12:56 p.m. CDT October 21, 2015 4 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
BATON ROUGE – The Southeastern Conference office has received film of alleged late hits on LSU tailback Leonard Fournette from LSU, but LSU coach Les Miles will keep the office’s reaction in the family. 
“That’s really kind of inner department workings if you would,” Miles said Wednesday morning on the SEC teleconference. “I’m not at liberty to share what goes on between what is the SEC office and here. So, I think I’ll refrain from doing so.” 
Miles said on Monday that film of what he and his staff viewed as late hits of Fournette in the Tigers’ 35-28 win over Florida on Saturday were sent to the SEC office. Fournette gained 180 yards on a career-high 31 carries in the game and complained of several illegal grabs to his face mask during the game. Fournette also took a swing with his left hand at a Florida defender during a run. 
SEC coordinator of football officials Steve Shaw did not immediately return a call to his office. 
“We have open dialogue,” Miles said of the SEC office. “And basically what happens many times is they tell us how to operate, what the ruling is, so that we can teach it best. I think there’s real quality open dialogue between the officiating, Steve Shaw, and really the rest of the coaches.” Read or Share this story: http://www.theadvertiser.com/story/sports/2015/10/21/miles-not-commenting-sec-response-fournette-hits/74330106/ TOP VIDEOS
